unnormalised: ## Aiyyo! Why You Leaving That Saree in the Cart, Yaar? A Hilarious Look at Cart Abandonment
normalised: ## Aiyyo! Why You Leaving That Saree in the Cart, Yaar? A Hilarious Look at Cart Abandonment

unnormalised: Okay, folks, let's talk about something that keeps us e-commerce folks up at night, worse than a bad episode of Bigg Boss: Cart Abandonment. You know, that moment when someone lovingly browses your website, adds that gorgeous Banarasi saree (looking at you, Priya!), maybe even a matching potli bag, and then… poof! Vanishes like Gabbar Singh into the night.
normalised: Okay, folks, let's talk about something that keeps us e-commerce folks up at night, worse than a bad episode of Bigg Boss: Cart Abandonment. You know, that moment when someone lovingly browses your website, adds that gorgeous Banarasi saree (looking at you, Priya!), maybe even a matching potli bag, and then… poof! Vanishes like Gabbar Singh into the night.

unnormalised: It's like standing outside IIT Delhi trying to explain the offside rule in football. Utter chaos and confusion!
normalised: It's like standing outside I I T Delhi trying to explain the offside rule in football. Utter chaos and confusion!

unnormalised: But why, O shoppers of India, why?! Is it the price looking higher than Mount Everest after all those add-ons? Did your mom call saying "Beta, don't buy anything online, it's all khota (fake)!"? Maybe your wifi decided to throw a tantrum right before you clicked "Pay Now"? We've all been there, especially during peak hours in Chandni Chowk.
normalised: But why, O shoppers of India, why?! Is it the price looking higher than Mount Everest after all those add-ons? Did your mom call saying "Beta, don't buy anything online, it's all khota (fake)!"? Maybe your wi-fi decided to throw a tantrum right before you clicked "Pay Now"? We've all been there, especially during peak hours in Chandni Chowk.

unnormalised: Seriously though, cart abandonment is a pain. It's like ordering a plate of delicious biryani and then realizing you left your wallet at home. The agony!
normalised: Seriously though, cart abandonment is a pain. It's like ordering a plate of delicious biryani and then realizing you left your wallet at home. The agony!

unnormalised: But fear not, fellow online retailers! We're not going down without a fight. We're talking tempting discounts, free shipping that arrives faster than a Mumbai local, and enough payment options to make your head spin (UPI, Net Banking, Credit Cards, even COD for the truly hesitant!). We're pulling out all the stops.
normalised: But fear not, fellow online retailers! We're not going down without a fight. We're talking tempting discounts, free shipping that arrives faster than a Mumbai local, and enough payment options to make your head spin (U P I, Net Banking, Credit Cards, even C O D for the truly hesitant!). We're pulling out all the stops.

unnormalised: So next time you're browsing online and find that perfect kurta for Diwali, don't leave it hanging in the digital abyss! Think of the poor saree, lonely and unloved. Give it a good home (your wardrobe!), and give us, the hardworking e-commerce folks, a good night's sleep. Please? Rs. 50 off, final offer! And 2 day shipping in Bangalore!
normalised: So next time you're browsing online and find that perfect kurta for Diwali, don't leave it hanging in the digital abyss! Think of the poor saree, lonely and unloved.
